name: Tactical Command
desc: Shout encouraging commands that make your allies stronger and more confident in battle. Your words boost their fighting spirit and physical power.
notes: Classic leadership ability fitting Gorean military culture. Warriors and commanders can rally their troops in battle.
bookReferences: Tarnsman of Gor - Military command structure

name: Combat Expertise
desc: Focus your mind and body to fight better. You become much stronger and faster for a short time.
notes: Core warrior ability. Represents focused combat training and battle experience. Requires concentration check.
bookReferences: Tarnsman of Gor - Warrior caste training

name: Battle Cry
desc: Shout a fierce battle cry at your enemy. Your intimidating roar weakens their strength and confidence.
notes: Universal intimidation ability. A larl's roar, a tarn's screech, or a kurii's bellow - all creatures can terrify their enemies. Success depends on winning a Charisma contest.
bookReferences: Tarnsman of Gor - Warrior intimidation tactics

name: Second Wind
desc: Take a moment to catch your breath and recover. You regain some health as your body pushes through pain and exhaustion.
notes: Universal survival ability representing natural resilience. Restores 10% of maximum health. Cooldown enforced by checking recent ability usage events (30 minutes = 1800 seconds).
bookReferences: Tarnsman of Gor - Warriors enduring prolonged combat and recovering between engagements
Outlaw of Gor - Tarl's natural healing and recovery in the wilderness

name: Capture Throw
desc: Tackle and pin your enemy to the ground. You grab them and throw them down, leaving them stunned and unable to move.
notes: Universal capture ability. Warriors subduing enemies, slavers capturing valuable merchandise, predators pinning prey. Success requires overpowering enemy's reflexes (Strength vs Agility). Stuns for 1 turn, representing being momentarily pinned. 30-minute cooldown (1800 seconds) enforced via events table.
bookReferences: Hunters of Gor - Capture techniques and slave binding
Nomads of Gor - Warriors subduing enemies for interrogation
Beasts of Gor - Predators immobilizing prey
